name: df-ufil
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wceq(cufil, cmpt(s0, universe, crab(s1, cfv(cfil, cv(s0)), wral(s2, cpw(cv(s0)), wo(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wcel(cdif(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cv(s1)))))))
bodyPretty: âŠ¢ UFil =(s0 âˆˆ ğ•Œ â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ(Fil ` s0)| âˆ€(s2 âˆˆ P(s0),(s2 âˆˆ s1 âˆ¨(s0 \ s2)âˆˆ s1))})
comment: Define the set of ultrafilters on a set. An ultrafilter is a filter that gives a definite result for every subset. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 30-Nov-2009.)
